The page full of demos might give you some ideas for itsÂ use.

Zach Leatherman

This first one is for a furnitureÂ site.

Andy Bell

You're Gonna Need A Bigger Browser â€” Yes, browsers are hugely load-bearing in the webâ€™s architecture, and Robin notes they havenâ€™t really changed all that much. As such this post questions some aspects that seem worthy candidates for change to best serve the user goingÂ forward.

Jonathan Dallas

Bosch sponsor

Chris Coyier

â–¶Â Â Why Passkeys are the Future
Siegfried, deploy!

Folks like Supabase, Redux and Temporal use it for their doc sites. v3 features an upgrade to MDX v3, React 18, Mermaid v10, and essentially modernizesÂ everything.

SÃ©bastien Lorber

Tiny Helpers: Online Tools for Web Developers â€” We first featured this now sizeable collection of single-purpose online tools around three years ago, and it has since grown to over 500 resources. It has plenty of tools aimed at developers of all types â€”Â think things like color management, favicon generators, accessibility tools, and more.

Stefan Judis

Nightwind: Automatic Dark Mode for TailwindÂ Sites â€” An innovative and customizable Tailwind plugin that takes your current color choices into consideration when constructing a dark mode theme for your site. Try it out directly on theÂ page.

Nightwind

TailwindMate: Convert CSS Colors to and from Tailwind Format â€” Enter any CSS color (RGBA, HSLA, hex) and this tool will convert the color to the closest Tailwind named equivalent. You can also switch to â€œfrom Tailwindâ€ mode.

Jaleel Bennett

SiriWave: The Apple Siri Waveform Replicated in Pure JS â€” If you need an effect that implies sound is playing or being recorded, perhaps.

Flavio Maria De Stefano

FormsLab: An Open-Source Form Builder Toolkit for Creating Surveys, Polls, and More

Konrad Ryczko

items.title: When a hundred developers code the same layout
items.content:
ğŸš€ Frontend Focus

#â€‹615 â€” October 25, 2023 | Read on the web

Introducing Horizontal Rules for <select> â€” As of Chrome 119 and Safari 17, you can add <hr> elements into a list of select options as a way to visually break them up that differs from the <optgroup> approach. A beautiful coming together of two of the oldest HTML elements to create somethingÂ new.

Una Kravets (Chrome Developers)

ğŸ¨Â Vectorpea: An Online Vector Editor â€” Photopea is a popular online image editor that just celebrated its tenth birthday â€“ what better way to celebrate than releasing a vector version? Itâ€™s not Adobe Illustrator yet, but thereâ€™s plenty to enjoy and you can export your creations as SVGs for yourÂ projects.

Ivan Kuckir

Supercharge Video Streaming With ImageKit's Video CDN â€” Unleash the full potential of your videos with ImageKit's Video CDN. Supercharge your video streaming with Adaptive Bitrate Streaming and a global video CDN to deliver a buffer-free viewing experience on any device,Â anywhere.

ImageKit | Video CDN sponsor

â–¶Â Â When 100 Developers Reproduce the Same Web Layout â€” A popular web design YouTuber asked folks on his Discord to reproduce a â€˜cardâ€™ layout however they wished. In this video, he analyzes the approaches taken which mostly break down between using grids and flexbox â€“Â though one plucky individual went with tables! (16Â minutes.)

Kevin Powell

An Introduction to Web Sustainability â€” What can designers and developers do to build a more sustainable web? Michelle explores the environmental impacts of web tech and looks at how to build greenerÂ sites.

Michelle Barker

âš¡ï¸ IN BRIEF

  • Chrome 117 has introduced text-wrap: pretty â€“ a new setting for the text-wrap property that handles typographic widows andÂ orphans.

  • ğŸ’ What Does Happily Ever After Look Like? is a beautiful piece of modern web design (and a cool data-led look at romance novel book coversÂ too).

  • Ricky Onsman has shared a thorough list of newsletters and blogs focused on digital accessibility.

  • We've mentioned the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines a lot, as WCAG 2.2 came out recently. If you want to get up to speed, Geoff Graham has a roundup of WCAG 2.2 explainers.

  • Safari Technology Preview 181 landed just after we sent last week's issue. It adds support for content-visibility.

ğŸ“™ Tutorials, Articles & Opinion

The Three Cs: ğŸ¤Â Concatenate, ğŸ—œï¸Â Compress, ğŸ—³ï¸Â Cache â€” When serving and storing files on the web, Harry notes that there are a number of different things we need to take into consideration in order to balance ergonomics, performance, and effectiveness. This meaty post breaks these processes down into three: concatenating files on the server, compressing them over the network, and caching them at the otherÂ end.

Harry Roberts

Using ChatGPT for 'Smart Truncation' in Responsive Design? â€” Weâ€™re not saying this is a great approach, but the idea of â€˜responsive contentâ€™ (where the length of written content is adjusted to fit the viewing environment) is certainlyÂ intriguing.

Mike Solomon

This Way of Learning to Code Will Blow Your Mind ğŸ¤¯ â€” Get 30% off Scrimba Pro plans covering JS, React, CSS & AI, taught by experts Kevin Powell, Bob Ziroll, andÂ more!

Scrimba sponsor

No More 404 â€” Remy shares a neat solution to dreaded link rot that leans onÂ archiveâ€¤org's WaybackÂ Machine.

Remy Sharp

Changing Colors in an SVG Element with CSS and JavaScript â€” Almost everything inside an inline SVG image is up for modification using CSS andÂ JavaScript.

Kirupa Chinnathambi

Generating Tailwind Width Configs with Generative AI â€” Tasking ChatGPT, Github Copilot, and Phind with generating width configs ended with mixed results, with just one taking the golden ratio intoÂ account.

Lucian Ghinda

â–¶Â Â Using CSS Custom Properties Like This is a Waste â€” A little PSA from Kevin on how to simplify things when using CSS customÂ properties.

Kevin Powell

How TechCrunch Spent $1 Million Rebuilding Their Website
Jamie Marsland

â–¶Â Â Web Accessibility Strategies for Non-Accessible Projects
AdriÃ¡n Bolonio

ğŸ”§ Code, Tools & Resources

cccolor: A HEX, RGB and HSL Color Picker for HTML / CSS â€” There are a lot of color pickers for designers, but this new one is neat with color values available to quickly copy to the clipboard as RGB, HSL, hex, orÂ oklch.

ffffffuel

Color Contrast Accessibility Tools with Examples â€” Sticking to the topic of color, here are a few ways to approach checking that the contrast between colors is good from an accessibilityÂ perspective.

Whitney Lewis

Accelerate Your Development with Catalystâ€”Get $250 in Credits + a Free Trial â€” Simplify your development workflow, harness the power of machine learning, effortlessly deploy apps, and automate like neverÂ before.

Catalyst by Zoho sponsor

Beer CSS: Build Material-Based Designs in Record Time â€” A CSS framework based on Material Design 3 whose name is inspired by a German â€˜beer purity lawâ€™ where beer should have only the essential ingredients. Similarly, Beer CSS only has settings, elements, andÂ helpers.

Beer CSS

Ruffle: A Flash Player Emulator â€” Built in Rust, Ruffle targets both desktop and the web using WebAssembly. Time for a Flash renaissance? ğŸ˜† Of course there areÂ demos.

Ruffle

404 Illustrations: Trendy 404 Images â€” Thereâ€™s a handful of fun images that may well work on your Page Not Found pagesÂ here.

Kapwing

imgly/background-removal: Remove Backgrounds From Images â€” A way to remove backgrounds from images directly in the browser (yes, thereâ€™s a live demo) without relying on a third party service. It relies on a large pre-trained model to do this, however, and is GPLÂ licensed.

imgâ€¤ly

ğŸ•° ICYMI (Some older stuff that's still worth checking out)

  • In Miriam Suzanne's talk from CSS Day 2023 she shares a â–¶ï¸ deep-dive introduction to CSS Container Queries.

  • A comparison of the page performance gains and effects â–¶ï¸Â betweenÂ using preload, early hints, and fetch priority.

  • If you're not up to speed yet, Krasimir Tsonev gives a short intro to the new and approved style of CSS nesting.

How Custom Property Values are Computed â€” Stephanie brings us up to speed on how browsers compute CSS custom property values, noting that a misunderstanding of this process may lead to unexpected or missing values. She shares some simple strategies we can use to avoid custom propertyÂ failure.

Stephanie Eckles

CSS Findings from Photoshop's Web Version â€” A few weeks ago we shared an update about how Adobe took Photoshop to the web. Now Ahmad has taken a look over the impressive effort, digging into the CSS of the web version of this mammothÂ app.

Ahmad Shadeed

Streamline API Development With Postman Workspaces â€” Postman workspaces give teams shared access to the API tools they need to solve problems together. They are the go-to place for development teams to collaborate and move quickly while staying on the sameÂ page.

Postman sponsor

HTML Tags Memory Test: Test How Well You Remember 100+ HTMLÂ Tags â€” Just start typing HTML tag names to see how many you can remember. Guaranteed to drive you to despair when you give up and find out you missed some easy ones you use all the time! ğŸ¤£

Paul Foster

âš¡ï¸ IN BRIEF

  • Astro 3.3 is out now with a new, experimental <Picture/> component.

  • The latest list of emoji recommendations drafted by the Unicode Consortium, Emoji 15.1, has been formally approved with 118 new emoji.

  • The 'State of the Word' WordPress survey is open & seeking responses.

  • ActivityPub is now available across all WordPress.com sites.

CSS Relative Color Syntax â€” This post runs through how to use new, powerful color syntax features (in Chrome as of version 119) that allow you to make dynamic color adjustments (such as lighten, darken, invert, saturate, etc) along with demonstrating some common color manipulation useÂ cases.

The Negative Impact of Mobile-First Web Design on Desktop â€” Some considered criticism about mobile-first design highlighting a handful of usability issues dubbed here as â€˜content dispersionâ€™. Whether you agree with itÂ thoughâ€¦

Salazar, Neusesser, Chitale

Create Collaborative Apps Like Figma and Miro in Days with Ably â€” Create collaborative features, from live cursors to avatar stacks with Spaces, our in-app collaborationÂ SDK.

Ably sponsor

Scroll-Driven State Transfer â€” Roman continues his spelunking into all things relating to scroll-driven animations, this time looking at how to transfer the state of one element to another placed at a different point on the page. This is done by using a unique identifier in CSS viaÂ timeline-scope.

Zach Leatherman

Postman sponsor
